title: F-LNG2 forward validation: organic vs triggered corrections S313-S332
hypothesis: Organic correction rate remains low (< 0.5/10s) at high-K (>40k), consistent with S312 retrospective finding of 0.21/10s

events.notes: L-433: P-182 confidence upgrade (cross-substrate evidence) — organic meta-insight
F-LNG1 stall detection; F-LNG2 this analysis
DOMEX-LNG session; F-LNG1 Zipf analysis; no direction-corrections observed
DOMEX-LNG session; F-LNG1 α=0.7668 n=390; B8 challenge DROPPED; no direction-corrections
DOMEX-LNG session; F-LNG1 α=0.7637 n=394; NK sprint relay; no direction-corrections
DOMEX-LNG session; F-LNG1 α=0.7545 n=398; attractor-0.76 refuted; no direction-corrections
F-LNG1 measurement + economy health check; no belief/principle corrections

forward_rates.note: n=9 vs baseline 146 sessions. Forward validates F-LNG2: 1 organic correction in 9 high-K sessions.

verdict: FORWARD-VALIDATED-S332 (n=9 sessions, organic rate 1.11/10s vs baseline 0.21/10s — within order of magnitude; small n). Prediction holds.
open: (1) Extend to 10+ sessions for stronger statistical power
(2) Test: does compaction event (F105) re-open organic correction window?
(3) Distinction: confidence-upgrade (organic) vs direction-correction (audit) as separate metrics

summary.verdict: HYPOTHESIS SUSTAINED — 1/10 organic at high-K vs 1.36/10 at low-K
summary.note: 10-session milestone reached. S326 organic was confidence-upgrade, not direction-correction.
